medical_history.chief_complaint: unprovoked right upper quadrant and midepigastric pain
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The pain began approximately 12 hours prior to presentation. It had no relation to food intake. The patient experienced 4-5 episodes of non-bilious, non-bloody emesis and chills but without fever. About 1 week ago, following recent travel, she had one episode of emesis that resolved, without abdominal pain at that time.
